page.title: 17GARDENING DOWNDERRY
page.content: A NOTABLE FEATURE OF GARDEN & RUDERAL PLANTS IN THE AREA IS THEIR WORLD ORIGIN.PLANTS FROM THE ANTIPODES SEEM TO THRIVE IN THIS CLIMATE. OBVIOUS PLANTS FROM NEW ZEALAND INCLUDE THE CABBAGE PALMS (CORDYLINE),SEVERAL DAISY BUSHES AND THE SHRUBBY SENECIOS. ESCALLONIA,PITTISPORUM,EUONYMUS, FUCHSIAS AND MANY HEBES FLOURISH TO PROVIDE SUBSTANTIAL WINDBREAKS IN SALTLADEN AIR. TAMARISK,EVERGREEN OAK, MIMOSA,ACANTHUS AND BAY LAUREL FORM A MEDITERRANEAN COMPONENT.MEXICAN FLEABANE IS COMMON ON WALLS .ON THE CLIFF FACE HOTTENTOT FIG OUSTS SOME NATIVE PLANTS.THIS YEAR GOATSBEARD, MADDER & MILK-THISTLE WERE NOTED.A TERRESTRIAL AMPHIPOD FROM NEW ZEALAND IS,SINCE{1983},WELL ESTABLISHED HERE.ON THE SHORE,JAPWEED IS FOUND STRANDED BUT NO ATTACHED PLANTS HAVE YET BEEN FOUND NEARER THAN LOOE.
